de.must.markup
Interface Markupable

All Known Subinterfaces:
Presentable, Storable
All Known Implementing Classes:
BackButton, CancelButton, DataBoolPresenter, DataCheckBox, DataComboBox, DataDateField, DataDatePresenter, DataDecimalField, DataDecimalPresenter, DataFileUploader, DataImageViewer, DataIntField, DataIntPresenter, DataLinkPresenter, DataPasswordField, DataReferencePresenter, DataTextArea, DataTextCheck, DataTextField, DataTextPresenter, DataTimeField, DataVariableChoice, DataVariableChoiceNumKey, FileUploader, HalfDataComboBox, HiddenField, ImageViewer, LinkPresenter, MarkupableObject, MustBoolPresenter, MustButton, MustCheckBox, MustDateField, MustDatePresenter, MustDecimalField, MustDecimalPresenter, MustInputField, MustIntField, MustPasswordField, MustReferencePresenter, MustStatusLabel, MustTextArea, MustTextField, MustTextPresenter, MustTimeField, MustTimestampPresenter, OkButton, RadioButtonGroup, SearchButton, TabButtonGroup, TabButtonGroupForJsp, VariableChoice, VariableChoiceNumKey
public interface Markupable

A view to different types of objects to be rendered via markup language. Markupable objects are designed similar to JComponent.

See Also:
MustInputField, GroupOfMarkupables

getCreationTag

java.lang.String getCreationTag()
Returns the tag sequence that's needed to show this object in the user interface. At the moment, HTML is supported.

Returns:
the tag sequence to show the component

destroy

void destroy()
Destroys the markupable. Useful to release e.g. static references which prevent the garbage collector from finalizing. For example HalfDataComboBoxes add themeselves as Listeners to database changes. These listeners are registered statically. Thus, these listeners cannot be removed by the garbage collector, they have to be removed manually. This may be done by calling this destroy method.
